qas.question: Can one increase their brain efficency?

answers.text: people can improve cognitive function and brain efficiency

qas.question: What can a person do to increase their brain efficiency?

answers.text: simple lifestyle changes such as incorporating memory exercises, healthy eating, physical fitness and stress reduction

qas.question: In a study performed with 17 subjects, what relationship did healthy changes and brain efficiency have?

answers.text: After 14 days, they showed greater word fluency (not memory) compared to their baseline performance.

qas.question: Do lifestyle changes definitely have an affect on long term memory?

answers.text: it is therefore unclear if this intervention has lasting effects on memory.

qas.question: Who published a study in a June 2006 issue of UCLA?

plausible_answers.text: people can improve cognitive function and brain efficiency

context: A UCLA research study published in the June 2006 issue of the <b4_0>American Journal of Geriatric Psychiatry<b4_0/> found that <a0_0><b5_0>people can improve <b6_0>cognitive function and brain efficiency<b6_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/> through <a1_0>simple lifestyle changes such as incorporating memory exercises, healthy eating, physical fitness and stress reduction<a1_0/> into their daily lives. This study examined <b8_0>17 subjects<b8_0/>, (average age 53) with normal memory performance. Eight subjects were asked to follow a "brain healthy" diet, relaxation, physical, and mental exercise (brain teasers and verbal memory training techniques). <a2_0>After 14 days, they showed greater <b7_0>word fluency<b7_0/> (not memory) compared to their baseline performance.<a2_0/> No long term follow up was conducted, <a3_0>it is therefore unclear if this intervention has lasting effects on memory.
